enrolled-dateline.#text: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Friday, the third day of January, two thousand and fourteen

congress.#text: One Hundred Thirteenth Congress of the United States of America

official-title.#text: To require the Attorney General to report on State law penalties for certain child abusers, and for other purposes.

role.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives.
Vice President of the United States and President of the Senate.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Kilah Davenport Child Protection Act of 2013
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Kilah Davenport Child Protection Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall publish and submit to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on the Judiciary of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report on the penalties for violations of laws prohibiting child abuse in each of the 50 States, the District of Columbia, and each territory of the United States, including whether the laws of that State, District, or territory provides for enhanced penalties when the victim has suffered serious bodily injury, or permanent or protracted loss or impairment of any mental or emotional function.

header.#text: Expansion of predicate for increased penalties for certain domestic assaults
